N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 212-2.1 - Requirements

State Regulations

Emissions of air contaminants to the outdoor atmosphere
from any process emission source or emission point are restricted as
follows: (a) for an air contaminant
listed in Section
212-2.2

Table 2 - High Toxicity Air

Contaminant List, of this Part, the facility owner or operator shall either
limit the actual annual emissions from all process operations at the facility
so as to not exceed the mass emission limit listed for the individual HTAC; or
demonstrate compliance with the air cleaning requirements for the HTAC as
specified in Subdivision 212-2. 3 (b), Table 4 - Degree of Air Cleaning

Required for Non-Criteria Air Contaminants, of this Part for the environmental
rating assigned to the contaminant by the department. (b) for any air contaminant not listed on

Table 2, unless it is a solid particulate described in subdivision (c) of this

Section, the facility owner or operator shall not allow emissions of an air
contaminant to violate the requirements specified in Subdivision
212-2.3
(a), Table
3 - Degree of Air Cleaning Required for Crite ria Air Contaminants of this

Subpart, or Subdivision
212-2.3
(b), Table
4 - Degree of Air Cleaning Required f or N o n -Criteria Air Contaminants of
this Subpart, as applicable, for the environmental rating assigned to the
contaminant by the department. (c) for a solid particulate assigned an environmental rating of B or C emitted from
a process emission source, the facility owner or operator shall not allow
emissions of particulate to exceed the requirements specified in Subpart
212-2.4 of this Part. Notes
